question1.Still in a relationship: Keep this plan updated, and remember you can always reach out if things escalate.
question1.Planning to leave: Start packing small items now so you're ready when you decide to leave.
question1.Post-separation: It's normal to feel unsettled, refer back to this plan whenever you need a safety reminder.

question2.tip: Save the local support numbers for {city} in your phone's speed-dial so you can call immediately if you need help.

question3.tip: Keep your essentials (phone, keys, and a small flashlight) in {safe_room} so you can grab them instantly when you need to leave.

question4.Family/Roommates: Let those you live with: {family/roommates} know your safe room and cue-word so they can support you in an emergency.
question4.Alone: Since you live alone, identify a trusted neighbor or friend and share your safe room location with them.
question4.Partner: Because you live with your partner, keep your safety plan hidden (in {safe_room}), and consider storing a digital copy in a password-protected note they won't see.

question5.Yes: Practice your safety plan with your children so that when they hear {code_word}, they know exactly what to do.
question5.No: Even without children, it helps to identify a second safe space in your home.

question1.tip: If you face {abuse_type} abuse, remember you don't have to face it alone. Reach out to your emergency contact right away.

question2.Yes: Log each incident (date, time, and a brief note) so you have clear records if needed later.
question2.No: Even brief notes on your phone can be helpful. Start logging today.

question3.tip: Save {contact_name} in your phone under a code-word so you can quietly call them when you need help.

question1.tip: Set a real target {leave_timing} and pack one essential item each day until you're ready.

question2.Yes: Great! Keep your go-bag in a hidden spot so you can grab it quickly.
question2.No: Pack a simple go-bag today with essentials like your ID, some cash, and a charger.

question3.tip: Stash some cash and a spare card in {money_location}, a spot your partner won't suspect.

question4.No: Reach out to Victim Services Toronto or a trusted friend now to secure a shelter option before you leave.
